alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 9:28PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Thunderstorm outflow will impact portions of eastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 1000 PM MDT... At 926 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorm outflow along a line extending from 11 miles north of Cheyenne Wells to 7 miles northeast of Eads. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This outflow will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Arapahoe and Firstview. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 136 and 169. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
